text:
I’ve read FCCA several times, and Analogy-Making as Perception, and Copycat’s source, and can confirm that it’s unimplementable. :joy: I did get a nub of it working in Wolfram Language the other day, though. And I have ideas for how LLMs may be used to break out of the toy domain.

I’d love to talk (a lot) more with other people who have thought deeply about it, because I share the belief that there are useful techniques that would be useful in programming generally, in the way Sussman had in mind when he said, “This piece of the problem wants to be a functional program. This piece of the program wants to be imperative. This piece wants to be object-oriented. And guess what, this piece wants to be logic-based.”

If I ever have the time to devlog, it will be about this. :)

text: Oh wow, this is a better overview than the first paper I read on this. Thanks!
